indications:
Indications in combination with aspirin for the
prevention of atherothrombotic events in patients with acute coronary
syndrome undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention
name: PRASUGREL
cautions:
Cautions patients at increased risk of bleeding
(e.g. from recent trauma, surgery, gastro-intestinal bleeding, or
active peptic ulcer disease); concomitant
use of drugs that increase risk of bleeding; discontinue at least 7 days before elective surgery if antiplatelet
effect not desirable; elderly; body-weight less than 60 kg; history of hypersensitivity reactions to thienopyridines (e.g. clopidogrel); interactions: Appendix 1 (prasugrel)
side-effects:
Side-effects haemorrhage (including gastro-intestinal and intracranial),
haematoma, haematuria, anaemia, rash; less commonly hypersensitivity reactions including angioedema; rarely thrombocytopenia; also reported thrombotic thrombocytopenic
purpura
doses:
adult over 18 years, (with
aspirin—see notes above) initially 60 mg as a single dose
then body-weight over 60 kg, 10 mg once daily or body-weight
under 60 kg or elderly over 75 years,
5 mg once daily
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit
outweighs risk
